intro: Xylopia lastelliana var. acuta, commonly known as the sharp-leafed xylopia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Annonaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central America and northern South America. The plant is characterized by its aromatic, rough-textured leaves and small, clustered white flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release winged seeds. This species is often found in humid, lowland forests and is valued for its ornamental and medicinal properties.
